Ready-made funds based on your preferred risk level

1

Choose your risk level

Understanding how comfortable you are with different levels of risk is the first step to planning your investments.

You'll see that changing your attitude to risk affects the amount you could get back so you might need to adjust the lump sum, monthly contributions and time it takes to achieve your savings goal.

Estimated values

Good market £13,000
-%
Average market £10,000
-%
Poor market £8,000
-%
Cash

Focused on capital preservation, while still aiming to generate modest investment returns over the long term by taking a smaller amount of risk.

Aims for steady returns over the years and will hold an even split of higher-risk and lower-risk investments.

More balanced, by placing emphasis on long term capital growth but also holding some more defensive assets.

Focused on higher long term returns. Although well diversified, holds higher risk assets such as equities, commodities and property.

All out for growth by investing in equities around the world. We believe there is great potential for long term growth, but you must understand you are taking on a high level of risk.

How our forecasting works

As you can see for each risk level, we've selected three different potential rates of return, representing a good, poor or middling outcome for an investment help over the long term (ten years or more).

If you increase your selected risk level, the high and middling rates of return improve, while the poor return is worse. These forecasts illustrate that taking on greater risk can increase your returns if the market is good, but also increases your losses in poor market conditions.

You can find out more about our forecasting methods here

2

2

Now decide how you'd like your money managed

To continue your planning based on the risk level you've selected, choose one of the following fund types.

Active

Your money actively managed by our experts. Invests in a range of global assets and primarily funds managed by Fidelity.

Select this fund type

Passive

Invests mainly in index tracking funds with the aim of keeping costs low and providing long term growth.

Select this fund type
